headerSection.heading: The Crash Course about me
headerSection.text: I am a curious and open-minded developer with a background in sales and customer service. I enjoy creativity and really love to think outside the box. Throw in a splash of color, cool animations, a touch of playfulness and a pinch of humor and thats what you’ll get from me in a future collaboration.

projects.name: Todo List
projects.text: A responsive and accessible task manager built with React, Zustand, and styled-components. Users can add, complete, star, and delete tasks. All data is persisted using localStorage. Designed mobile-first and optimized for accessibility.

projects.name: Happy Thoughts
projects.text: This project focuses on working with APIs and React. It’s a simple, interactive app where users can share their happy thoughts with others. The main goal was to follow a Figma design and build a responsive web app using React and an external API. I used Postman to test API requests, which proved to be very helpful throughout the development process. This project was both fun and a great learning experience.

projects.name: ScreamFlix
projects.text: This project focuses on APIs, React, and React Router. The goal was to learn how to fetch and display data in a user-friendly way, and to build a single-page application with multiple routes using React Router. It was a fun and rewarding project that involved working with several modern tools and technologies.

projects.name: Web Accessibility Quiz
projects.text: This project focuses on web accessibility. The goal was to learn how to develop inclusive digital experiences that work for everyone, regardless of their functional ability. We worked with semantic HTML, proper use of ARIA attributes, sufficient color contrast, keyboard navigation, and responsive design.

projects.name: Morbid Gene Official
projects.text: This was one of my very first projects, built with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. It’s the official website for the band Morbid Gene. This project is a personal favorite, as it involved real client collaboration and showcasing unique, creative content.

projects.name: Weather app
projects.text: This group project focused on using the OpenWeather API and TypeScript. We collaborated using Git with multiple branches and learned how to handle merge conflicts when they occurred. It was a fun and motivating experience that strengthened both technical and teamwork skills.

projects.name: Recipe Library
projects.text: This project uses the Spoonacular API to dynamically display real recipes. It was a fun challenge to follow a finished Figma design and implement it with a responsive layout and real-time data fetching for an engaging user experience.

myJourney.heading: My Journey
myJourney.text:
I’ve been a [[creative]] soul for as long as I can remember. What truly drives me is that deep sense of curiosity and the joy I feel when I get to explore, build, and solve. When I’m fully immersed in a challenge  whether it's solving a tricky bug or designing an engaging user experience - I actually find a sense of calm and focus that I absolutely love. [[Tech gives me the perfect mix of creativity and logic.]]
I thrive on digging into the details, being analytical and stubborn when needed, and seeing how every small piece contributes to something greater. Watching an idea grow from scratch into a functional, visual experience - where design, interactivity, and problem-solving meet - is pure magic to me.
With several years of experience in logistics, sales, and customer service, I’ve developed strong problem-solving skills and a deep understanding of how to work efficiently in fast-paced environments. [[This background has also given me a strong user-focused mindset - I always think about how things will feel and function for the end user.]] Now, I’m combining all those strengths in my journey into tech. Whether it’s writing code, creating accessible and responsive web interfaces, or simply learning something new.
